Improvement Pill here, welcome to Lesson #11
of the Tamed Course.

In our previous lessons - We learned about
how habits and willpower work but today we're

going to talk about something that strikes
at the root of our problem.

We're going to talk about 6 things that you
must have in your life.

You might be able to build a couple of good
habits, you might be able to increase your

willpower – but without these 6 fundamental
human needs you will not be able to overcome
your addiction for good.

And this is a concept that was first introduced
by Tony Robbins.
So let's jump right into it:

The first fundamental human need is a sense
of Certainty.

Human beings need to have some idea of what
to expect in the future.

For example: going to work for 40 hours a
week and knowing that you'll make say 500$
every week.

If we do not have certainty in our lives,
that creates a tremendous amount of stress.

Imagine showing up to work everyday and not
knowing what your paycheck is going to look
like at the end of the week.

How confident will you be about pay the bills
or putting food on the table?

When we have a lack of certainty in our lives
we tend to reach for things that do give us
certainty.

For example: If I smoke a couple of cigarettes,
or drink a couple of beers I know that I will
feel good.
That is for certain.

A good way to combat this by setting up habits
with consistent rewards.

For example: If I meditate everyday in the
morning, I know that I will feel better for
the rest of the day.

But above all certainty is most needed in
terms of job and home security.

Forget about trying to build good new habits
forget about overcoming your addictions - Without

having a steady stream of income, without
knowing that you'll have a roof over your

head, without knowing that you'll have food
to eat everyday it is near impossible to overcome
your addictions for good.
The second fundamental human need is variety.

Now I know I know, doesn't this contradict
what we just talked about?

Well when I say variety – I'm talking about
the sense that our lives aren't boring.

If you're working a 9-5 every single day,
with the same exact routine where you come

back home and watch the same tv shows and
eat the same food, then you're going to have
an extremely hard time overcoming your addictions.
Because your addiction offer a sort of excitement.

When you're drunk or high the whole world
feels different, it adds some variety into
your life.

In order for us to combat this, we need to
make sure that we have an exciting life.

This means having exciting hobbies that really
interest us.

This means going on exciting trips every once
in a while.

This means trying out new things, new foods,
new ideas, and even meeting new people.

If we can bring more excitement into our lives
we'll reach for the excitement that our addiction
provides far less often.
The third fundamental human need is significance.
We need to feel important, like we matter.

And this is often done in a variety of different
ways.

Some people do this by building up a business
and making millions, others do so by getting

really good at their craft, and some people
even do this by creating unnecessary drama
in their lives.

Without a source of significance we'll just
reach for our addiction of choice.

There's a reason why people like doing drugs
like cocaine, because it makes you feel like
the most important person in the room.

In order to combat this we can cultivate our
own version of significance.

And this differs from person to person but
a general rule of thumb is, if there's something
you daydream about.

Then chances are that dream of yours will
provide you with a sense of significance.

The 4th fundamental human need is Love and
Connection.
We human beings are social creatures.

It's even been found that if you do not socialize
with anyone for a long period of time your
brain will actually get smaller.
We need to form intimate bonds with people.

We need to care about others and also feel
like others care about us.

And this is one of the most common fundamental
human needs that is not being properly fulfilled.

So many people nowadays spend too much time
behind their screens to the point where they

no longer know how to go out there and actually
connect with people.

If you don't bond with others in real life,
then you'll find yourself reaching for bad
habits that can fulfill this need.

That's why so many people nowadays are addicted
to things like social media or even pornography.

So many young men nowadays watch pornography
because it tricks your brain into thinking

that you are being loved by dozens of women
unconditionally.

In order to combat this we need to work on
our social skills.

We need to be able to hold deep and meaningful
conversations with the people in real life.

If you're having trouble with any of this
I do have a couple of videos on communication

skills which I will link to in the description
below.
The 5th fundamental human need is growth.

We human beings need to see progress or improvement
in our lives.

We need to see that if we're working on something
every single day that we're getting better
or getting better results.

This is why so many people with good paying
jobs still end up quitting after a while because
they see no room for improvement.

They see very little to no increases in pay,
they see no opportunity to climb within the

company and because of this they feel a strong
urge to leave.

Now you don't need necessarily need to see
progress at work, a lot of people fulfill

their need for progress by reaching for their
goals.

Someone who starts hitting the gym on a regular
will see clear progress in the amount of weight
he can lift as well as in his body.

If you do not have some sort of positive growth
in your life then you're going to look for
it elsewhere.
Many people find progress in their addictions.

Although they build more and more tolerance
to their substance of choice and their addictions

get worse and worse, they stay around because
that fulfills their need for progress.

It just so happens that this progress isn't
good for us.

In order to combat this we need to make sure
that we're making positive progress somewhere
in our lives.

This is why focusing on self-improvement,
watching videos like this, and applying the
lessons to our lives is so powerful.

Because building good new habits and working
on ourselves can fulfill this need.

The 6th and final fundamental human need is
contribution.

Studies have actually found that a large majority
of the happiest people in the world are the

ones who give backWhen you provide happiness
for others that makes you happy as well.

It shows you that you're capable of giving
value to others, and this ties back with the
fundamental need to feel significant.

Now this need can be fulfilled in a couple
of ways.
You can give back to the community.

Do some community service, help out your friends
and family whenever they're in need, and you

can also do this by working on yourself so
that you can bring more to the table.

If you work on your social skills and become
a happier person you can make others around
you happier as well.

And that's it these are the 6 fundamental
human needs that we need to fulfill.

If you are lacking in any of these areas you
will find it near impossible to overcome your
addiction.

And this is because your addiction is fulfilling
the need for you.
This is the final video of the Tamed Course.

At this point you now know everything you
need to know in order to overcome your addiction.

If you don't I suggest you click on the link
in the description below and re-watch some
of the lessons.

But I will sum up our strategy one last time
to make sure that you're on the right path.

In order for us to overcome our addictions
we need to fulfill the 6 fundamental human
needs.

We do this by using our knowledge of willpower
and habits to building a single keystone habit.

This keystone habit will make us stronger
and allow us to build other good habits down
the line.

So continue to focus on building your keystone
habits.

Get it to the line of automaticity which again
can take up to 9 months and start fulfilling
your 6 fundamental human needs.

As each of the 6 are being naturally fulfilled
you should find it easier and easier to stay
away from your addiction of choice.

And eventually it will no longer be a major
problem in your life.
